Colin, that's great, I've added links to SharpNEAT 2 from my homepage's H=
yperNEAT software list and also from the HyperNEAT Users Page, so people sh=
ould become aware of its availability.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "=
Colin" <colin.green1@...> wrote:
>
> On 19 June 2010 23:58, Ken <kstanley@.=
..> wrote:
> >
> > Colin, congrats. SharpNEAT has been a great resource and=
 I am sure 
> > version 2 will be appreciated. I was wondering how you feel=
 about 
> > the HyperNEAT component of SharpNEAT 2.0. Do you consider a ful=
l 
> > release of HyperNEAT? That is, is it an alternative to the two 
> > =
current releases that we have out?
> 
> 
> Hi Ken, thanks. Yes as of this r=
elease I'm happy to declare it a full
> implementation of HyperNEAT; That p=
art of the code in particular has
> been through a few changes over the las=
t few weeks and months - e.g.
> initially the substrate was limited to 2D w=
hereas now the
> dimensionality is not actually limited. Implementing the '=
boxes'
> visualization task highlighted that issue and a few other defects =
and
> design niggles that have been ironed out.
> 
> The main question I fo=
resee is the speciation by k-means which I want
> to do a bit of investigat=
ion on - some kind of visualization of the
> species/clusters to confirm it=
 works as expected and maybe identify
> some improvements. However the NEAT=
 code (which the HyperNEAT code is
> of course built on) is performing at l=
east as well as in SharpNEAT 1.x
> so I don't foresee any problems there.
>=
 
> And of course if anyone here would like to see a particular HyperNEAT
>=
 task implemented to help prove/test the codebase then I'd be happy to
> ha=
ve a look (depending on how much work is involved :)
> 
> Colin
>
